results:
Based on my search results, I found information about "Folwark zwierzęcy" (Animal Farm) and Polish youth's social media reading habits. Here's what the search revealed:

## Folwark zwierzęcy (Animal Farm) in Poland

Folwark zwierzęcy is George Orwell's novel about farm animals that expel humans and start ruling the farm themselves. It is an allegorical representation of Stalinism and a warning against any totalitarianism.(no content)The book was banned by censorship in Poland until almost the fall of the communist system in 1989 - its first official domestic edition was published only in 1988.(no content)The book is not only reading material for youth, but also a valuable proposition for adults, and Orwell is best known for the novel "Animal Farm."(no content)Reading with commentary is excellent help and inspiration for students and teachers, with the text equipped with interpretive guidelines and keywords that facilitate navigation through the book.

## Polish Youth and Social Media Reading Habits

### TikTok and Instagram Dominance Among Youth

Instagram and TikTok are the most popular platforms among teenagers, with these two apps still enjoying the greatest interest from younger users, outpacing competing platforms like Snapchat or YouTube.(no content)The youngest age groups (7-14 years and 15-24 years) spend the most time on TikTok, while TikTok, Instagram and Snapchat are popular among younger users.

### How Social Media Changes Reading Habits

Today, if youth reaches for new reading material, it's most often because they saw it on Instagram or TikTok. Social media has completely changed the way books reach young people.(no content)When someone your age recommends a book, it sounds more credible, right? That's why young people so eagerly read what they see on Instagram or TikTok.

### Instagram's Book Community (#Bookstagram)

Instagram is a true mecca for book lovers. If you haven't heard of #Bookstagram yet, you absolutely must catch up! It's a community where beautiful photos of books reign - the kind that make you immediately want to have them on your shelf.(no content)Well-known faces on Instagram who regularly share reviews have a huge impact on what youth reads.

### Polish Social Media Statistics

At the beginning of 2024, TikTok had 11.5 million adult users in Poland. Ads published on this platform have a chance to reach 34.7% of all adults.(no content)There is no exact data on what portion of children, youth and young adults in Poland use social media as their main source of information and news. However, according to research conducted by the Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism at Oxford University, 30% of respondents aged 18 to 24 said that social media is their most important source of information.

The search results show that while "Folwark zwierzęcy" remains an important literary work in Polish education, social media platforms like TikTok and Instagram are significantly influencing how Polish youth discover and engage with books, creating new pathways for literary discovery through visual, peer-driven recommendations.
